titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller Foundation records, Administration, Program and Policy, SG 3.1 and SG 3.2
A Guide to the Rockefeller Foundation records, Administration, Program and Policy, SG 3.1 and SG 3.2 FA112
titlestmt.author: Harold W. Oakhill

did.unittitle: Rockefeller Foundation records, administration, program and policy, SG 3.1 and SG 3.2

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The Administration, Program & Policy material is physically divided into two groups; RG 3.1 and RG 3.2. The first group contains earlier material, up to about 1950, while the second group contains mostly later material, roughly 1950 to 1980, though there are some exceptions.
There are 28 separate entries, arbitrarily numbered, dividing the material into areas of administrative or program interest. Files within these series are arranged alphabetically.
Many files in RG 3.1 continue into RG 3.2.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This material consists of administrative and program and policy information in the form of correspondence, memoranda, minutes, and reports.
The Foundation's archives include:

Projects General Correspondence Administration, Program and Policy China Medical Board International Health Board/Division Field Offices Treasurer's Office Comptroller Personnel Fellowships Information Services Diaries Oral Histories Counsel Secretary Minutes and Officers Actions Dockets Declinations (100F) Non-textual Materials Communications Office

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Rockefeller Foundation has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them. Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and reports related to administrative, financial, organizational, and program and policy matters. In the Program and Policy section of this series can be found general policy information and policy statements on specific questions which are not confined to one program. Of special interest is a 21 volume history of the Rockefeller Foundation compiled from original sources covering the years 1909-1939.

It was replaced by the Medicine and Public Health Division in 1951.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda and reports concerning the development and administration of programs in agriculture and in natural sciences. The agricultural interests were combined with the Natural Sciences Division in 1946. A new program called Natural Sciences and Agriculture was formed in 1951. The natural sciences aspect was terminated in 1955. It was resurrected in 1959 when two new programs were formed: Agricultural Sciences; and Medical and Natural Sciences.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: SEE ALSO: Series 900 General Program and Policy, Program and Policy, Food SEE ALSO: Series 923 Agriculture SEE ALSO: Series 924 Medical and Natural Sciences

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda and reports concerning program and policy development in this program following the termination of the Natural Sciences and Agriculture program in 1955. The topics covered by this material include the Board of Consultants for Agriculture, the production of the film "Harvest," about the Rockefeller Foundation's agriculture program, and the Foundation's agricultural publications. The bulk of the series is made up of individual staff files for temporary scientific aide appointments made by the Agriculture divisions from 1955 to 1965.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and reports related to administrative, financial, organizational, and program and policy matters. In the Program and Policy section of this series can be found general policy information and policy statements on specific questions which are not confined to one program. Of special interest is a 21 volume history of the Rockefeller Foundation compiled from original sources covering the years 1909-1939.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda and reports concerning program and policy development in this program following the termination of the Natural Sciences and Agriculture program in 1955. The topics covered by this material include the Board of Consultants for Agriculture, the production of the film "Harvest," about the Rockefeller Foundation's agriculture program, and the Foundation's agricultural publications. The bulk of the series is made up of individual staff files for temporary scientific aide appointments made by the Agriculture divisions from 1955 to 1965.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda and reports concerning program and policy developments in the medical and natural sciences. The topics covered include schistosomiasis and the role of nursing as a component in the Rockefeller Foundation's medical program. This series represents the re-emergence of the natural sciences as a Rockefeller Foundation program. This division succeeded the Medical Education and Public Health and the Biological and Medical Research Divisions in 1959 and was itself replaced by the Biomedical Sciences Division in 1970.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda and reports concerning the development of a program in the arts. The series includes files and papers from several Rockefeller Foundation supported conferences on arts related topics. Other topics covered include a proposed program to assist individual composers, the development of a fellowship program in the arts, and Foundation support of the recording of American music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda and a report concerning program and policy matters in this short lived program. Includes a report of a 1973 meeting to explore the possibility of Rockefeller Foundation support of basic research in immunology. The Biomedical Sciences Division succeeded the Medical and Natural Sciences Division in 1970 and was itself replaced by the Health Sciences Division in 1974.
